What is the purpose of the PBaaS testnet, and how can I participate in it using this release?

This release does not support the PBaaS testnet. To participate in the PBaaS testnet, you need to use the [PBaaS Cross-chain Technology Preview](https://github.com/VerusCoin/VerusCoin/releases/tag/v0.6.0.12-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview).

**MacOS:**
https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/4de5aa22de6d43554f3456abe690c4ca1405e3326748dda14710d85f66634919/detection
**Linux:** https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/4f5bc9cc22046b675fea304155026cc2c951ad4760ee5a2e27b42b5db8e4765d/detection
**Windows:**
https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/787d46b30681e86c20d1875ab3c18c3253168a680c801c64de7a9f43b8b2db2c/detectionAvast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/

What are the notable changes in the latest Verus release?

The notable changes in this release include renaming komodod and komodo-cli to verusd and verus, removing wrappers, minor staking improvements, fixing longest chain reporting, fixing the getchaintips bug, and preparations for PBaaS.

**MacOS:**
https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/4de5aa22de6d43554f3456abe690c4ca1405e3326748dda14710d85f66634919/detection
